\subsection{Null tests and empirical tail probabilities}
We evaluate the anchored lattice score $\overline{\epsilon}$ on the observed spectrum and on two pre-registered null ensembles. We report the one-sided empirical tail probability $p_{\mathrm{emp}}=\Pr(\overline{\epsilon}_{\mathrm{null}}\le\overline{\epsilon}_{\mathrm{obs}})$ estimated from $N_{\mathrm{null}}=2000$ trials (seed=1).

\paragraph{Observed score.}
\begin{equation}
\overline{\epsilon}_{\mathrm{obs}} = 6.940321\times 10^{-2}.
\end{equation}

\paragraph{Null A (i.i.d. log-uniform over observed range).}
\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{l c}
\hline
Statistic & Value \\
\hline
$\min$ & $1.166653\times 10^{-2}$ \\
$\mathrm{median}$ & $5.179576\times 10^{-2}$ \\
$16\%$ & $3.853807\times 10^{-2}$ \\
$84\%$ & $6.581013\times 10^{-2}$ \\
$p_\mathrm{emp}$ & $0.89$ \\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\end{center}

\paragraph{Null B (jittered spectrum in log-space).}
\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{c c c c c}
\hline
$\sigma$ & $\min$ & median & $[16\%,84\%]$ & $p_\mathrm{emp}$ \\
\hline
0.150 & $1.202008\times 10^{-2}$ & $5.152952\times 10^{-2}$ & $[3.816028\times 10^{-2},\,6.537605\times 10^{-2}]$ & $0.8995$ \\
0.300 & $1.177407\times 10^{-2}$ & $5.155763\times 10^{-2}$ & $[3.762496\times 10^{-2},\,6.610624\times 10^{-2}]$ & $0.892$ \\
0.500 & $1.414049\times 10^{-2}$ & $5.238391\times 10^{-2}$ & $[3.914064\times 10^{-2},\,6.576313\times 10^{-2}]$ & $0.9025$ \\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\end{center}
